subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Neuroscience of Prayer: What Happens in the Brain?
description: A fast breakdown of Neuroscience of Prayer: What Happens in the Brain? for builders.

hook.text: Brain scans show prayer lights up specific neural networks. Does that prove God is an illusion or brains are antennas?

buildup.text: Andrew Newberg's research shows meditation and prayer reduce parietal lobe activity, dissolving the sense of self.

discovery.text: Monks and nuns in deep prayer show similar brain patterns. The mystical experience has a consistent neural signature.

twist.text: Materialists say this proves God is brain activity. Believers say God designed brains to connect with the divine.

climax.text: Neuroscience describes the mechanism of spiritual experience. Whether it points to something real is still open.

punchline.text: Prayer changes the brain. Whether it reaches God, science can't say.

quiz.question: What do brain scans show during prayer?
options: Specific neural patterns that reduce self-awareness
